turn.1: What was the name of the play, George and Margaret?
turn.2: George and Margaret  George and Margaret is a comedy play by the British writer Gerald Savory which was first staged in 1937. It had a very successful run in the West End, beginning at Wyndham's Theatre before transferring to the Piccadilly Theatre, lasting for over seven hundred performances.
turn.4: The cast was headed by Nigel Patrick, Jane Baxter, Ann Casson and Joyce Barbour.
turn.5: Were there any other notable performers?
turn.6: The "New Statesman" critic singled out Irene Handl's brief appearance as a maid as a highlight.
turn.8: The new monarch George VI and his wife Elizabeth attended a performance of the show.
turn.9: Was there anyone else who performed or directed the play?
turn.10: Following its London success, Noël Coward directed the work for its transfer to Broadway.
turn.12: The play portrays a day in the lives of a middle-class London family and their servants.
